column4: when I go to use an ssh connection I get a "connection refused", but vnc works fine
what does vnc have to do with ssh?
Well it just means that I can get through the firewall
and try using the -v switch to ssh.  ssh -v user@host
that should make ssh verbose and give you an indication as to what's wrong.
my guess is that sshd is not running, your firewall is blocking ssh connections or your router, if you have one, isn't setup to forward ssh traffic
you say you have vnc access .. if you can try doing this.  sudo /etc/init.d/ssh* restart
and I have used vnc before
paste the full error message please.
that indicates that you don't have openssh-server installed.
